sub_title: Leadership Development ❖ Changing Hearts & Culture at Work ❖ Compassion teacher at CCARE Stanford University
summary:
We all want to feel safe, belong and add value, don't we? To feel good about ourselves and what we are doing. 

My work aims to support senior professionals in their leadership and change cultures at work moving towards more human leadership.

My background: after a successful 20+ year career in international communication management in the corporate sector & general management in health care facilities, I now design and deliver senior leadership programs. My experiences living and working abroad, built cross and intercultural sensitivity which allows me to work with a broad range of people as well as organisational cultures. 

I hold an MA in Communication, am a certified Stanford trained Compassion facilitator, a certified coach and experienced facilitator and mentor to senior leaders. My approach is systemic, somatic and holistic, combining different wisdom traditions in online as well as live programs.

Today, I work at THNK, school for creative leadership and act as compassion ambassador for CCARE at Stanford University. I am commited to living life with my full presence and an open heart. It’s about striving to be non-judgmental and kind in each interaction. And attempt to bringing these qualities of the heart to the forefront of our systems and decision-making. I believe that directing your attention inward first builds awareness, calms and clears the mind, and supports you find root in where you are, where you came from and where you want to go. As leaders of organisations as well as in your personal life. Then only can you have and take response-ability.

treasury_media.title: Cultivating the Heart Compassion Course
treasury_media.description:
Cultivating the Heart is designed to help you develop the skills of (self)compassion, (self)awareness, reflection, meditation and more, skills that are anchored in evidence-based practices. Cultivating foundational contemplative practices and finding root in your heart through Presence and Awareness is at the core of this 8-week online course.

I was responsible for Program design and development as well as delivering as faculty;

treasury_media.description:
'Ubuntu', which essentially means humanity: 'I am because we are'.
The intro is in Dutch and the interview in English #transforminghealthcare #positivehealth #compassion

treasury_media.title: Resilient Leadership | 5 Tips To Build Resilience
treasury_media.description:
An interview with two THNK colleagues and myself on Resilience!
In these uncertain times, resilient leadership is key. Learn more about what resilience really means and how you can build resilience as a leader.

treasury_media.title: Thrive Global articles - Re-membering to be Free
treasury_media.description: Yesterday, May 4th, 2020 was our National Remembrance Day in The Netherlands. At 8PM, the entire nation holds silent for 2 minutes to commemorate those who perished in the war and the holocaust. Today, May 5, 75 years ago, The Netherlands was liberated.

treasury_media.title: Words on a Wall: A Poem and Reflection on CCT | Home | Compassion Institute
treasury_media.description: Barbara Piper-Roelofs is a life coach, poet, and alumna of Senior Teacher Robert Cusick's CCT class. She has kindly shared with us a poem inspired by her experiences in CCT, along with a reflection on "the gap," her word for the critical moment between noticing suffering and reacting with intention. You can find her at berooted.nl or on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram”

projects.title: Designer of Program Dealing with Change (NL -'Omgaan met Veranderen))
projects.description: The training Dealing with Change was designed to support people during company change. Working with group sizes around 12-14, my training theory and exercises focus on creating awareness about the way Change works from a Systemic Dynamics point of view. Day one is all about awareness on the different stages of Change and Day two is about gaining insight in yourself and how these insights can help you help yourself during change.

profile_positions.description:
THNK, the School of Creative Leadership's mission is to develop the next generation of global creative leaders across corporate, private, public, and social sectors which will have a significant societal impact in our world. Together, we create innovative solutions to the world’s most pressing and inspiring challenges.

At THNK, my roles are both senior leadership faculty as well as program director for corporate clients. Amongst other clients, I thoroughly enjoy being dedicated to leadership programs for Fugro, ASML, Adyen and DSM.
profile_positions.title: Program Director and Faculty Senior Leadership Programs

company.name: The Center for Compassion and Altruism Research and Education | CCARE at Stanford University

profile_positions.company: The Center for Compassion and Altruism Research and Education | CCARE at Stanford University
profile_positions.description:
Design & Development and Faculty of the Compassion Course - 'Cultivating the Heart'

Cultivating the Heart is an 8-week online course designed to help you develop the skills of (self)compassion, (self)awareness, reflection, meditation and more, skills that are anchored in evidence-based practices. Cultivating foundational contemplative practices and finding root in your heart through Presence and Awareness is at the core of this 8-week course.

Mentor to ACT Participants
Mentor in the Applied Compassion Training at CCARE; overseeing and supporting a group of mentees with the development, implementation and evaluation of their individual Capstone Projects necessary to graduate from the training. Facilitating Mentoring Groups in the European time zone. 

The Applied Compassion Training (ACT) is an experiential 11-month online certificate training offered through the Center for Compassion and Altruism Research and Education (CCCARE) at Stanford University. ACT is for people who are ready to be leaders of global compassion in today's world.
profile_positions.title: Program Design & Faculty CCARE at Stanford University (Compassion Ambassador)

profile_positions.description:
❖ 10-week Corporate program on Personal Wellbeing ❖  Empowering professionals through live and online programs ❖ Combining personal wellbeing practices with meditation 

❖ Clients include VMWare; University Eindhoven; The Centre for Mathematics & Computer Science (CWI); Creatinc; Stanford University and Positive Health International

Design & develop leadership programs on topics of Personal Wellbeing & Resilience and Compassion. We create value for companies through bringing young professionals across the globe in contact with the application of contemplative and compassionate practices.
profile_positions.title: Chief Heart Officer

profile_positions.description:
Design & Development of a 6-month mentor program for academic Tenure Track professionals with focus on finding root as an individual, team or organisation. Fostering resilience to support academic professionals in their challenging environment and tasks in the tenure track. 

The Centre for Mathematics & Computer Science (CWI) is part of the NWO-I, an independent foundation that falls under the Dutch Research Council (NWO), which manages nine national research institutes connecting Dutch science with the international scientific community. The institute enjoys a global reputation for their innovative research.
profile_positions.title: Mentor (Programs) for Young Academic Professionals

profile_positions.description: Supporting the global roll-out of Positive Health.
profile_positions.title: Program Director & Faculty International Programs

profile_positions.description:
The design and development of the ICC Compassion Community was my Capstone Project for the Applied Compassion Training 2020 Program at CCARE Stanford University

A collaboration and initiative with BFC CCMM. The global pandemic inspired us to support professionals in Health and Care with daily live online meditations with an International team of experienced teachers.
profile_positions.title: Co-Design & Development International Compassion Community for Health and Care

profile_positions.description:
The concept of Positive Health has changed the Dutch Health Care landscape by breaking away form focusing on dis-ease and moving towards positive health; creating a new and more holistic system in Health Care.  A key element of the concept is living a Meaningful life, a life of resilience and wellbeing.
As lead Academy and Educator supported the roll-out of Positive Health nationally as well as across the borders (Iceland, Belgium, Japan and Germany).
(Today 170 Trainers)
profile_positions.title: Program Director & Faculty National and International Programs

profile_positions.title: Coach Trainer

profile_positions.description:
Poetry as an entry point sparking conversations that matter.
A series of open mic evenings at Spark Art Gallery for poetry sharing and more. A monthly gathering of community, spoken word, good food and art.

“Creator of Poetry Bites, Life coach and poet Barbara Piper, will moderate and lead us through the evening, aligning with artists and the monthly shows in the gallery.  

Barbara Piper reads from her poetry collections and invites people into the conversation. Much of her poems are a conversation between herself and the different parts of her Jewish, German, English, and Dutch heritage. She also ventures into more recent work around being brave and moving away from those family ties to moving into a new way of being. By holding the conversation lightly, deeper connections and new insights are woven into the evening with ease."
profile_positions.title: Founder Poetry Bites

volunteer_experiences.description: 'Dialoog in Den Haag' organizes dialogues in and for the city of The Hague with various organisations. The dialogues take place throughout the city in community centers, schools or in organizations. We facilitate dialogues with relevant topics that concern us all, aiming to connect people through this invitation for reflection and in-depth conversations.

volunteer_experiences.role: co founder Alumni team at aCalm
volunteer_experiences.description:
aCalm was created in 2020 by the first cohort of students from the Applied Compassion Training offered by the Applied Compassion Academy in connection with CCARE, the Center for Compassion and Altruism Research Education from the Stanford Medicine School. 

We envision a world where Compassion is at the heart of what we do, who we are and how we live.

Rise and Lead supports an ambitious tribe of women to achieve their personal and professional goals. We are leading the change towards closing the gender leadership gap. To learn more visit our website on www.riseandleadwomen.com

volunteer_experiences.role: Youth Writing tutor @ the Writing Lab: Personal Identity and Poetry Podcasting
volunteer_experiences.description:
826 Valencia was founded in 2002 by author Dave Eggers and educator Nínive Calegari. 826 Valencia is a nonprofit organization dedicated to supporting under-resourced students ages six to eighteen with their creative and expository writing skills and to helping teachers inspire their students to write. 

As a Tenderloin Center volunteer, I supported youth as they create (poetry) podcasts.
In this program, we work with students to craft poems about their personal identities. 

"Volunteers help students create vivid, compelling, and reflective podcasts, and record their pieces with style and confidence. Tutors will work with students as they brainstorm, write, and revise their poems and help prepare students to record their podcasts and explore audio editing and online publishing.

volunteer_experiences.role: Youth trainer - Educational program 'A history of today' in California
volunteer_experiences.description:
Trainer for the Educational Projects Department of the Anne Frank House in Amsterdam, Holland. Working with the training team for the International travelling education program: The exhibition 'A history of Today' as a trainer to California middle and high schools students. 
http://www.annefrank.org/en/Worldwide/

Volunteer at Jack Kornfield's Spirit Rock Center in Marin County. 
Spaciousness, stillness, insight and support for your inner journey.
